DOC.detailed_description: Exposure methylmercury , developmental toxicant find primarily fish . Fish nutritionally important provide long chain omega-3 fatty acid important perinatal health . Since maternal transfer mercury omega-3 fatty acid primary route fetal ( placental transfer ) infant ( maternal milk ) exposure , critical need develop specific advice childbearing-aged woman base upon 2004 Dietary Guidelines Advisory Committee 's recommended intake i.e. , consume 8 ounce fish per week . This clinical trial investigate whether weekly consumption select fish specie 12 week improve plasma concentration omega-3 fatty acid ( eicosapentaenoic acid ( EPA ) docosahexaenoic acid ( DHA ) ) reduce hair blood mercury concentration .
DOC.criteria: Hair mercury level equal great 0.8 ppm Pregnant planning become pregnant next 3 month Nursing
